intro: Phacelia tenuipes, commonly known as the slenderstem phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has hairy leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Phacelia tenuipes is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
